You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. 
As a brand built on going above and beyond to provide the best customer experience, having the most exceptional colleagues is paramount. As the face of the company, you can create positive interactions with our customers every day– from curating a unique travel or lifestyle experience to helping them with their everyday needs. And, you can grow your skills through industry-leading training and ongoing coaching, all while learning what it means to continually set the standard for world class, customer-first service. Find your place in service on #TeamAmex.
How will you make an impact in this role?
A Recruitment Coordinator (RC)  works directly with the Recruitment team and has responsibility for coordinating the interviews schedules, making travel arrangements, escorting candidates, creating offer letters, moving the requisition in the different stages in the process, new hire and other related administrative duties for designated functional areas of the client’s organization.
 
Key Responsibilities:

Work as a Recruiter Assistant during different stages of recruiting process.
Create offer letters and obtain the necessary approvals. Ensure all information is accurately reflected and all supporting documentation is provided.
Provides support and assistance to Recruitment Team and Team Leaders creating and Managing a hiring requisition.
Develop and coordinate timely interview schedules for candidates utilizing internal email calendar technology (i.e. Microsoft Outlook).
Telephonically screens potential candidates to evaluate their skills, profile and if a candidate is a good fit for American Express.
Manage any schedule changes and modify the schedule accordingly.
Email candidate resume (and any other required documents) and interview schedule to the interview team and candidate.
Ensure that all pre-hiring documents are legally valid, accurate and correspond to the candidate in question.
Communicate directly with candidates and coordinate all related travel arrangements following corporate travel guidelines.
Electronically provide the candidate with the approved company application and related reading materials.
Update the applicant tracking system appropriately and in a timely manner.
Escort the candidate to interviews on the day of on-site meetings and manage the “candidate care” aspect of the candidate’s interview day.
Collect hard copy applications and related materials and file accordingly.
Schedule all preparation meetings with the appropriate member of the recruitment team.
Attend to the welcoming of the new hires once the selection process is closed.

Skills & Qualifications
 

University degree or advanced student in Labor Relations, Human Resources, or other related studies.
Advanced/bilingual English so the selected candidate can communicate with Hiring Leaders from different Markets.
Ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines to complete hiring demands.
Functional personal computer/software knowledge to manage different systems used to the day to day chores.
Strong written and verbal skills to communicate candidly, clearly, and frankly.
Organization skills to complete every task asked.
Proven ability to manage many projects/tasks at the same time.
Customer service/ customer facing skills.
Self-starter profile with an innovative thinking.
Experience working with Microsoft Office – Outlook (or other calendar management systems).
Experience working in a fast past environment.
Experience working in a team.

 
At American Express we are proud to celebrate and promote Diversity, as well as, committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity. Our mission is to continue creating a diverse and inclusive environment, that fully supports your personal and professional development. Be yourself, be in American Express.
